0.Pros: working with a variety of people
0.Cons: Pay can be pretty low, high turn over with employees

1.Pros: it fun and you'll make new friends
1.Cons: to many rude customers manager stuck up

2.Summary: "One bad manager can make or break you"
2.Pros: Most coworkers were kind, friendly, and helpful, including most managers.
2.Cons: Bad management ruined my experience, one in particular was rude and condescending, practically verbally abusive to most staff.

3.Pros: Its a great team to work on and they do feed you free meals under a certain cost
3.Cons: It gets very busy and the mangement is not all that great. They tried to inforce hours that werent even my hours.

4.Pros: Working at McDonald's is often looked down upon and treated as a joke, a joke until you see how many times they come in to eat
4.Cons: The hours are kind of bad u either work 9-5 or 4pm-1am some nights 2 just cleaning the store and preparing for the morning shift

5.Pros: Free food, nice customers, new menu items
5.Cons: Some mangers are nice and others are not.

6.Pros: free/or discounted food, some of the people you meet working there.
6.Cons: hours are not consistent, the hourly wage is low, work life can be frustrating...Hungry and angry customers..The only thing the managers are focused on is keeping the hourly labor below $20 an hour. No considerations made for their human employees not even water breaks

7.Pros: Overall, the job was fairly simple.Good pay, started at 8.25, 20 cents over minimum wage
7.Cons: Rude customersLower management was not understanding

8.Pros: McDonalds staff is a group of driven and enthusiastic individuals who come in every day passionate and loving what they do
8.Cons: Sometimes can be too fast paced. Shifts can be arduous and help may be needed at last minute needs as demanded.

9.Pros: They adapt to your schedule and give you good hours.
